subject: Re: [junit] DBC
msgSnippet: ... Not necessarily. A collection of unit tests, correctly written, can be an unambiguous statement of the contract. Clarity is added value and not guaranteed.
messageBody:
>>Are a collection of unit tests a clear statement of the contract? <<

Not necessarily.

A collection of unit tests, correctly written, can be an unambiguous
statement of the contract. Clarity is added value and not guaranteed.
Correctness, of course, always depends on the test writer.

J. B. Rainsberger
President, Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com
Let's build software that people understand
